intro: Cyrtorchis buchholziana, commonly known as the Buchholz’s orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and green. The plant has a rhizomatous root system and grows in shaded, moist environments. Its leaves are grass-like and arranged in a rosette pattern, aiding in water retention. Cyrtorchis buchholziana is often found in cloud forests, where it thrives in the cool, humid conditions.
